meanings.definition: A person who carries a sacred vessel or basket in ancient Greek religious processions.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, the canephors walked solemnly, holding the sacred basket.
meanings.sent2: The canephors led the procession, each carrying a beautiful vessel on their head.
meanings.sent3: The canephors accidentally dropped the sacred basket, causing a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: She moved gracefully through the crowd, like a canephors carrying a precious vessel.
meanings.sent5: The image of the canephors with their baskets stayed etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A decorative motif in ancient Greek art featuring a basket or vessel carried on the head.
meanings.sent1: The painting displayed intricate canephors, adding elegance to the artwork.
meanings.sent2: In the sculpture, the canephors motif symbolized grace and beauty.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully incorporated canephors into the mural, surprising the viewers.
meanings.sent4: Her hat resembled the canephors motif, making her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The canephors design on the vase was striking and captivating.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Greek vase depicting a canephoros.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a collection of canephors vases from different eras.
meanings.sent2: The canephors vase depicted a scene from a religious procession.
meanings.sent3: The ancient canephors vase was accidentally knocked over during the exhibit.
meanings.sent4: The intricate details on the canephors vase revealed the skill of the artist.
meanings.sent5: The canephors vase stood out among the other artifacts in the museum.
